oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Performance - Dave Pomeroy - 2018-09-09
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Musicians spotlight program featuring Dave Pomeroy from the Ford Theater at the Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum on September 9, 2018. Includes questions from the audience.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Dave Pomeroy;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Walk-in music / (00:55) Opening comments and introduction by Kayleigh Shoemaker / (04:35) Opening comments from Dave / (05:14) Talks about his background and musical influences / (06:17) Introduces the first song / (06:44) Performs Date With A Bass / (09:18) Talks about the acoustic bass and the electric bass and plays a bass riff that changed his life / (10:34) Takes about the influence of bassist Jack Bruce on him / (11:50) Talks about his first professional engagements and moving to London England / (13:12) Talks about moving to Nashville and his first gig in town / (15:06) Talks about starting to work with Guy Clark / (16:03) Introduces the next song / (16:28) Talks about his bass and German bassist Eberhard Weber / (17:20) Talks more about Guy Clark and about Emmylou Harris / (17:59) Talks about the effects he will use on the next song / (18:54) Performs Old Friends / (22:04) Talks about getting to know Don Williams' band and beginning to work with Don / (24:30) Introduces the next song / (25:28) Performs 'Til The Rivers All Run Dry / (27:30) Talks about Don Williams / (28:25) Introduces the next song / (30:26) Performs The Day Bass Players Took Over The World / (33:32) Introduces Garth Fundis in the audience and intros the next song / (36:52) Performs Tomorrow Never Knows / (41:11) Talks about what he's learned from the Beatles / (41:48) Introduces the next song / (43:27) Performs There's A Healing Comin' / (47:15) Talks about Nashville, the local music scene and the American Federation of Musicians / (48:57) Introduces the next song / (51:26) Performs Pendulum / (56:16) Closing comments / (56:36) Walk-out music / (57:06) FILE END
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Pomeroy, Dave; Country Music Hall of Fame & Museum (Nashville, Tenn.);
